intro: Alansmia elastica, commonly known as the elastic alansmia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, a feature typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Alansmia elastica is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
